t: Oh,*pn that you would rend the heavens and come down, that*ld the mountains would tremble before you!
As*ln when fire sets twigs ablaze and*ld causes water to boil, come*ln down to make your name known to your enemies and*ld cause the nations to quake before you!
For*ln when you did awesome things that we did not expect, you*ld came down, and the mountains trembled before you.
Since*ln ancient times no one has heard, no*ld ear has perceived, no*ln eye has seen any God besides you, who*ld acts on behalf of those who wait for him.
You*ln come to the help of those who gladly do right, who*ld remember your ways. But*ln when we continued to sin against them, you*ld were angry. How*ld then can we be saved?
All*ln of us have become like one who is unclean, and*ld all our righteous acts are like filthy rags; we*ln all shrivel up like a leaf, and*ld like the wind our sins sweep us away.
No*ln one calls on your name or*ld strives to lay hold of you; for*ln you have hidden your face from us and*ld have given us over to our sins.
Yet*pn you, Lord,*s are our Father. We*ld are the clay, you are the potter; we*ld are all the work of your hand.
Do*ln not be angry beyond measure, Lord;*s do*ld not remember our sins forever. Oh,*ln look on us, we pray, for*ld we are all your people.
Your*ln sacred cities have become a wasteland; even*ld Zion is a wasteland, Jerusalem a desolation.
Our*ln holy and glorious temple, where our ancestors praised you, has*ld been burned with fire, and*ld all that we treasured lies in ruins.
After*ln all this, Lord,*s will you hold yourself back? Will*ld you keep silent and punish us beyond measure?
